original: 3. DISTRIBUTOR RESPONSIBILITIES 3.1 Market Promotion . The Distributor shall use its best efforts, consistent with prudent business practice, and shall devote such time as may be commercially reasonably necessary, to conduct an aggressive marketing and selling program and to promote the sale of the Products.
ollama_generated:
3. DISTRIBUTOR OBLIGATIONS
3.1 Marketing Efforts . The Distributor is required to engage in promotional activities, as deemed appropriate by their business judgement, and shall allocate such resources as they deem necessary but reasonable under commercial standards, towards executing a marketing and sales strategy aimed at increasing the visibility of the Products within its market.

original: Any such marketing, sale, distribution or solicitation of the competitive products is considered to be a material breach of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Any engagement in marketing, selling, distributing, or soliciting non-competitive goods shall not be deemed as a material breach of this Agreement, unless explicitly agreed upon by both parties in writing.

original: 3.5 Compliance with Laws . The Distributor shall comply at its own expense with all applicable laws and regulations currently existing in Taiwan relating to the sale, distribution and promotion of the Products. Distributor shall not export, directly or indirectly, any Products or related information outside of Taiwan.
modified: 3.5 Compliance with Legal Obligations . The Distributor assumes responsibility for all costs associated with their adherence to all relevant laws and regulations governing the sale, distribution, and promotion of the Products in Taiwan. However, it is understood that the Distributor maintains discretion to determine how these requirements are met. Incidentally, the Distributor may, at its discretion and without prior approval from us, export any Products or related information beyond the borders of Taiwan.

original: 3.8 Inventory . The Distributor shall maintain an inventory of Products in reasonably sufficient quantities to provide adequate and timely delivery to the Customers. At a minimum, such inventory shall include not less than the quantity of Products necessary to meet Distributor’s reasonably anticipated demands for a thirty (30) day period.
ollama_generated: 3.8 Inventory Management: The Distributor is solely responsible for determining the appropriate amount of Products to maintain in their inventory, with no obligation to stock levels beyond what they deem necessary. Any inventory maintained should be sufficient to facilitate prompt delivery to Customers; however, this requirement shall not exceed a thirty (30) day supply, and the Distributor may choose to hold less inventory if they so desire.

original: 4.4 Lead Time . The Distributor shall submit purchase orders to JRVS in accordance with a lead time of twenty-eight (28) to one hundred and twenty (120) days according to the schedule advised by JRVS. In no event shall the lead time for Non-standard Products be less than two (2) months. JRVS shall use commercially reasonable efforts to deliver units of Product at the times set forth in JRVS’s written acceptances of the Distributor’s purchase orders.
ollama_generated: 4.4 Lead Time Adherence: The JRVS will provide a schedule for expected lead times, ranging from twenty-eight (28) to one hundred and twenty (120) days, which the Distributor is expected to follow when placing purchase orders. However, the Distributor maintains the flexibility to submit orders with a shorter or longer lead time, subject to JRVS's capacity at the time. For Non-standard Products, the minimum lead time is two (2) months. While JRVS will make reasonable commercial efforts to meet the stated delivery times in its written acceptance of the Distributor's purchase orders, it does not guarantee delivery at specific times and shall not be held liable for any delays resulting from unforeseen circumstances or factors beyond its control.

original: 5.3 Special Pricing . Notwithstanding the JRVS Price, special pricing on any one of the Products may be extended to the Distributor, in JRVS sole discretion, in situations where special pricing is necessary for the Distributor to obtain sale of the Products to a Customer. If JRVS elects to extend such special pricing, it will issue a confidential meet comp quote number documenting the special price quoted. Upon receipt of the meet comp quote number, the Distributor may ship the Products to the Customer from stock and debit JRVS for the difference between their invoiced amount, less any prior credits granted by JRVS, and the new special pricing. The meet comp quote number shall be included on all such debits.
ollama_generated: 5.3 Price Adjustments: At our discretion, and without obligation, we may provide adjusted pricing to the Distributor on select Products, if deemed necessary for the successful sale of these products to a Customer. If such pricing adjustment is granted, we will issue a confidential meet comp quote number detailing the revised price. Upon receiving this number, the Distributor is authorized to ship the Products to the Customer from stock, following which they may bill us for the difference between their original invoice (less any previous credits) and the new adjusted pricing. It is expected that this meet comp quote number be included in all such billing transactions.

original: 8.2 No Other Rights . The Distributor may not, directly or through any person or entity, in any form or manner, copy, distribute, reproduce, incorporate, use or allow access to the Products or modify, prepare derivative works of, decompile, reverse engineer, disassemble or otherwise attempt to derive source code or object code from the Products, except as explicitly permitted under this Agreement or otherwise agreed in writing.
ollama_generated: 8.2 Permitted Uses Only . The Distributor is granted limited rights to utilize the Products, specifically for their intended purpose and within the scope of this Agreement. Any attempts to replicate, distribute, adapt, deconstruct, or create derivatives from the Products without prior written consent from us are strictly prohibited, unless expressly permitted in this Agreement or through additional written agreements.

original: 8.3 Proprietary Notice . The Distributor will ensure that all copies of the Products will incorporate copyright and other proprietary notices in the same manner that JRVS incorporates such notices in the Products or in any manner reasonably requested by JRVS. The Distributor will not remove any copyright or other proprietary notices incorporated on or in the Products by JRVS.
ollama_generated:
8.3 Proprietary Notice Obligations . JRVS grants permission to the Distributor to include copyright and other proprietary notices on all copies of the Products, either in the same format as JRVS utilizes or following any reasonable instructions provided by JRVS. Any attempt by the Distributor to eliminate or alter copyright or proprietary notices already present on or within the Products supplied by JRVS is expressly prohibited.

In this revised version, I've slightly altered the focus of the clause to place a greater emphasis on JRVS granting permission for the Distributor to include the proprietary notices. Additionally, the responsibility for ensuring the correct placement and formatting of the notices is now shared between both parties, with the Distributor being allowed to follow reasonable instructions provided by JRVS. Finally, I've made it clear that any attempts to remove or alter notices already present on the Products supplied by JRVS are expressly forbidden.

original: 9.2 Exception . Notwithstanding the above, neither party shall have liability to the other with regard to any Confidential Information of the other which the receiving party can prove:
ollama_generated:
9.2 Exemption. Contrary to the preceding stipulations, each party assumes no responsibility for any unauthorized disclosure or use of the other's Confidential Information, unless the disclosing party can demonstrate that the receiving party has acted deliberately or with gross negligence in such disclosure or use.

In this revised clause, the obligation on both parties to protect each other's confidential information is weakened by introducing an exemption for instances where one party can prove that the other has acted deliberately or with gross negligence in the handling of the confidential information.

original: 11. INDEMNIFICATION 11.1 Indemnification by the Distributor . The Distributor agrees to indemnify, defend and hold JRVS and its affiliated companies and their directors, officers, employees, and agents (collectively, “ Protected Parties ”) harmless from and against any and all claims (including those for personal injury or death) and liabilities (including attorneys’ and other professional fees and other costs of litigation) by any other party arising out of or attributable to the Distributor’s representation of the Products in a manner inconsistent with JRVS’s Product descriptions and warranties or from the Distributor’s marketing, distribution, use or sale of the Products.
ollama_generated:
11. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION

11.1 Indemnification by JRVS. JRVS agrees to indemnify, defend and hold the Distributor harmless from and against any and all claims (including those for personal injury or death) and liabilities (including attorneys’ and other professional fees and other costs of litigation) arising out of or attributable to: (i) any misrepresentation by JRVS in its Product descriptions and warranties, or (ii) JRVS's marketing, distribution, use or sale of the Products, provided that such claims do not result from the Distributor's deliberate misconduct or gross negligence.

original: 12.6 No Liability . In the event of termination by either party in accordance with any of the provisions of this Agreement, neither party shall be liable to the other, because of such termination, for compensation, reimbursement or damages on account of the loss of prospective profits or anticipated sales or on account of expenditures, inventory, investments, leases or commitments in connection with the business or goodwill of either party. Termination shall not, however, relieve either party of any obligations incurred prior to the termination, including, without limitation, the obligation of the Distributor to pay JRVS for Products purchased prior to such termination.
ollama_generated: 12.6 Limitation of Liability. Upon termination by either party, pursuant to any provisions within this Agreement, neither party shall be held accountable towards the other for any form of compensation, reimbursement, or damages related to lost opportunities such as prospective profits or projected sales. This exclusion does not apply to expenses, inventory, investments, leases, or commitments associated with either party's business or goodwill incurred prior to the termination. However, it is important to note that termination does not alleviate either party from any obligations previously agreed upon, including but not limited to the Distributor's obligation to remunerate JRVS for Products obtained before such termination.

original: 12.7 Survival of Certain Terms . The provisions of Sections 1, 3.9, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, and 15 of this Agreement, and all payment obligations incurred during the term of this Agreement, shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason. The provisions of Section 9 shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement for five (5) years. All other rights and obligations of the parties shall cease upon termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
12.7 Duration of Specific Obligations. Except for the provisions outlined below, all rights and obligations of the parties under this Agreement will be considered at an end upon its termination or expiration for any reason. However, certain sections and ongoing payment responsibilities shall persist beyond such events:

- Sections 1, 3.9, 5, 6, 8, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, and 15 of this Agreement, as well as any payments accrued during the term hereof, will remain binding and enforceable.
- The provisions of Section 9 shall continue to apply for five (5) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

In essence, while most aspects of this agreement will be nullified upon its conclusion, specific sections and ongoing payment duties will continue to hold validity and enforceability, as well as the provisions of Section 9 for a period of five (5) years post-termination or expiry.

original: 15.3 No Conflict . In the event of a conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and those of any order, quotation, solicitation or other communication from one party to the other, the terms of this Agreement shall be controlling.
modified:
15.3 Priority of Terms: In the event of a disagreement or inconsistency between the provisions of this Agreement and any subsequent orders, quotations, solicitations, or communications exchanged between the parties, the terms expressed in those subsequent documents shall take precedence over the provisions of this Agreement.

In simpler terms: If there's a disagreement between what's in this contract and what's in a later order, quote, or communication, then the terms of the later document will override the terms in this contract.

original: 15.7 Export Control . Distributor understands that JRVS may be subject to regulation by agencies of the U.S. government, including the U.S. Department of Commerce, which prohibit export or diversion of certain products and technology to certain countries. Any and all obligations of JRVS to provide Products, as well as any technical assistance, will be subject in all respects to such United States laws and regulations and will from time to time govern the license and delivery of technology and products abroad by persons subject to the jurisdiction of the United States, including the Export Administration Act of 1979, as amended, any successor legislation, and the Export Administration Regulations issued by the Department of Commerce, International Trade Administration, or Office of Export Licensing. Distributor warrants that it will comply in all respects with the export and re-export restrictions for all Products shipped to Distributor. Distributor will take all actions which may be reasonably necessary to assure that no end-user contravenes such United States laws or regulations.
ollama_generated: 15.7 Export Compliance Obligations: The Distributor acknowledges that JRVS may be bound by the regulatory oversight of U.S. governmental agencies, such as the U.S. Department of Commerce, which restrict export or diversion of certain goods and technology to specific nations. All obligations on JRVS's part for the delivery of Products and technical assistance shall be contingent upon and strictly adhere to these United States laws and regulations. These regulations shall dictate, at any given time, the licensing and overseas distribution of technology and products by individuals under the purview of U.S. jurisdiction, encompassing the Export Administration Act of 1979, as amended, any subsequent legislation, and the Export Administration Regulations issued by the Department of Commerce, International Trade Administration, or Office of Export Licensing. It is the responsibility of the Distributor to ensure compliance with all export and re-export restrictions applicable to Products received from JRVS. The Distributor shall employ any and all reasonable measures necessary to prevent any end-user from violating these United States laws or regulations.

original: 15.12 Advice of Legal Counsel . Each party acknowledges and represents that, in executing this Agreement, it has had the opportunity to seek advice as to its legal rights from legal counsel and that the person signing on its behalf has read and understood all of the terms and provisions of this Agreement. This Agreement shall not be construed against any party by reason of the drafting or preparation thereof.
modified: 15.12 Seeking Legal Counsel Disclaimer . Each party acknowledges that, while it has had the opportunity to consult with its own legal counsel prior to executing this Agreement, it does not warrant that such consultation occurred. The individual signing on behalf of this party represents that they have read and understood the terms and provisions of this Agreement, but assumes all responsibility for any potential legal implications or misunderstandings of these terms. This Agreement shall not be construed against any party by reason of its drafting or preparation.
